sentences: I'm in my dorm room at midnight.
It's nearly 2:00 AM. While the world around me sleeps, my mind rolls with the secrets I hide from daylight.

(The scene opens in my modest, slightly cramped dorm room. A single desk lamp and the pale glow of my computer screen illuminate scattered notebooks, personal photos, and a half-empty mug. Rain taps steadily against a foggy window.)
I think to myself:

"Every day, I wear a mask. Out on campus, I'm that person everyone sees as bright and full of life. I laugh, I connect, and I let the world see only what I want them to see. But here—in the solitude of midnight—the mask dissolves, and I'm left with the raw, unfiltered pieces of a self I thought I could control."
I notice a blinking cursor on the empty text field of my social media post editor.
Scene 2: The Choice of Expression
You lean forward and begin typing. The screen shows your keystrokes as you compose:
"Behind every smile lies a wound unseen. Even the brightest lights cast deep shadows."
After you hit 'post,' the text vanishes into the digital ether. Almost immediately, a notification pops up.
"Your secrets are more obvious than you think."
You pause, feeling a chill. Is this a random troll—or someone from my past?
You scroll through a vibrant gallery of campus snapshots and cheerful posts.
Suddenly, one post grabs your attention:
Post from @ghosted_me: "They promised forever, then vanished into silence."
Almost simultaneously, a comment appears on one of your older posts.
[On-Screen Comment]
@empty_: "Some echoes never fade."
A surge of memories and unspoken pain floods you.
You sit motionless, watching the blinking cursor. The silence presses in around you.
You (Inner Monologue):
"Maybe if I surrender completely to the silence, the relentless noise in my head will finally fade. But what if that silence is just the prelude to something darker?"
Without warning, a direct message appears:
[On-Screen Notification]
@empty_: "You can’t hide from the truth inside you."
